results.title: Analysis of a television commercial
results.creator_credit: Vass Contis, Eric Halliday and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Eric Halliday interviews Bruce Kerridge, producer of the Mining Industry Council commercials and Dr. Ian Mills, a La Trobe University lecturer who indicate reasons for the production of a commercial and a method for interpreting the same.

results.title: Dance in education
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: A program that aims to unify folk dance activities throughout the schools of Victoria by highlighting a series of preparatory exercises, dances by primary school children and more sophisticated dances by ethnic groups.

results.title: More 'new' handwriting
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Diane O'Connor and Materials Production, Curriculum Branch, Ed Dept of Vic
results.brief_description: This is a sequel to”The New handwriting” which is part of a compilation tape entitled “Learning handwriting” It provides practical advice on such issues as the use of speed loops, alternative letter shapings and embellished handwriting. Also looks at teacher reactions to the change in style.

results.title: Beating the clock - at sport: the limits of human performance
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Steve Skok and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: One of a series of programmes produced in conjunction with the Youth ANZAAS Science Festival. While looking at the differences in human performances at Olympic Games, the question is raised as to how one person can do so much better than another and why performance times have improved so much
results.title_for_label: Beating the clock - at sport: the limits of human performance

results.title: Winter
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program hosted by Trevor Lunn and Kevin Koala invite guests to explain just what is Winter and how does the season affect us and the plants and animals around us. These guests come from the Melbourne Museum Education Service, Royal Melbourne Zoo Education Service and the Victorian Schools Nursery.
